page.title: 16Local Craftsmen
page.content: It was during the time of the industrial revolution that the building of railway lines to Wigan, Liverpool, Ormskirk and St. Helens took place thus providing a wider market for the industries and farmers. There is a long history of craftsmen in the area, blacksmiths, nailors, weavers, locksmiths, miners, coopers, merchants and stonemasons however the three main occupations were agricultural labours, pipe makers, and farmers. Once the geological formations of coal measures were discovered and several mines opened then this created another major source of employment. Of the main occupations in the area only agricultural labourers and farmers still remain.
